importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Date of the Hamas-led attack that killed Sergeant Major Tal Haimi, marking a pivotal moment in the Israel-Hamas conflict and the beginning of the hostage crisis.
The day the US-proposed Gaza ceasefire deal was signed, setting a timeline for the return of hostages and triggering diplomatic and military scrutiny over compliance.
Date of the identification of Sergeant Major Tal Haimi’s body and the continuation of hostage transfer efforts under the ceasefire agreement.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period spanning the Hamas attack on October 7, 2023, to the signing of the ceasefire on October 9, 2025, is central to the context of hostage transfers and diplomatic efforts.
The immediate post-ceasefire phase, during which Hamas is required to return deceased hostages, has become a point of contention and diplomatic tension.

keyTakeAways: Sergeant Major Tal Haimi, a 41-year-old Israeli military official, was killed in the October 7, 2023 Hamas attack while defending a kibbutz and was identified as a deceased hostage returned under the ceasefire agreement.
Haimi is the 13th deceased Israeli hostage to be identified since the ceasefire deal was signed, with 15 more believed to remain in Gaza.

Israeli authorities assert that Hamas may not be able to recover all deceased hostages due to war-related destruction and logistical challenges, raising concerns about compliance with the ceasefire terms.
One previously transferred body was misidentified by Hamas, suggesting potential errors in identification processes or possible intent to mislead.

The US-led ceasefire agreement, brokered by President Donald Trump, is under strain due to accusations of violations by both Hamas and Israel, with Trump threatening to 'eradicate' Hamas if it fails to comply.
US officials, including special envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, held high-level meetings with Israeli military leaders to ensure implementation and accountability of ceasefire terms.
The Hostages and Missing Families Forum expressed condolences to Haimi’s family, emphasizing the emotional and psychological toll of prolonged uncertainty and the significance of a proper burial.
Israeli leaders, including Knesset Speaker Amir Ohana, have reaffirmed the necessity of fulfilling the ceasefire obligations, including returning all deceased hostages, regardless of obstacles.

namedEntities.name: Sergeant Major Tal Haimi
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the 13th identified deceased Israeli hostage returned under the ceasefire deal, symbolizing both the human cost of the conflict and the ongoing efforts to fulfill the agreement.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Palestinian militant group responsible for the October 7 attacks
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is the entity responsible for the initial attack, and remains central to the current negotiation over the return of deceased hostages and compliance with the ceasefire.

namedEntities.name: Israel Defense Forces (IDF)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The IDF is directly involved in identifying and managing the return of hostages and has publicly accused Hamas of failing to deliver all deceased bodies.

namedEntities.name: United States (US)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Global superpower and broker of ceasefire
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The US proposed and brokered the ceasefire deal, with President Donald Trump and officials like Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner playing key roles in ensuring compliance.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Trump is a central figure in the geopolitical push, threatening to 'eradicate' Hamas if it violates the ceasefire, signaling strong US pressure on Hamas.

namedEntities.name: Steve Witkoff
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He participated in high-level meetings with Israeli military leaders to oversee ceasefire implementation and address hostage issues.

namedEntities.name: Jared Kushner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: US government official and Trump’s son-in-law
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He attended meetings with Israeli military officials, indicating direct US involvement in ceasefire negotiations and hostage return logistics.

namedEntities.name: Amir Ohana
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He publicly stressed the necessity of fulfilling all ceasefire obligations, including returning deceased hostages, showing political commitment from Israel’s leadership.

namedEntities.name: Red Cross
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Red Cross retrieved the body of Tal Haimi from Gaza and transferred it to Israeli forces, fulfilling a key logistical and humanitarian role in the hostage recovery process.

namedEntities.name: Hostages and Missing Families Forum
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The group expressed emotional condolences to Haimi’s family, highlighting the human impact of the hostage situation and the need for closure and dignity in recovery.

namedEntities.name: Thai national Sonthaya Oakkharasri
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She was the 12th identified deceased hostage, serving as a precedent for the process of identification and return under the ceasefire agreement.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Israeli authorities have identified the remains of Sergeant Major Tal Haimi, a 41-year-old IDF officer killed during the Hamas-led October 7, 2023 attack, as a deceased hostage returned under the US-brokered ceasefire deal. Haimi, the 13th such hostage identified since October 9, 2025, is the latest in a series of bodies being transferred by Hamas, amid growing concerns over Hamas’s ability to recover all deceased hostages due to war damage and possible misidentifications. The Israeli military and political leadership, including Knesset Speaker Amir Ohana, have stressed the absolute necessity of returning all deceased hostages. The US, led by President Donald Trump and officials like Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, continues to push for compliance, with Trump threatening to 'eradicate' Hamas if it violates the ceasefire. High-level diplomatic meetings between Israeli military leaders and US envoys underscore the geopolitical urgency of ensuring the ceasefire’s integrity and the human rights aspect of returning missing persons.
title: Israel Identifies Body of Deceased Hostage as Sergeant Major Tal Haimi
